TopicTitle: 80% Recoverable Bizarro-verse Space Shuttle (Orange tank to orbit)

Articles.Content:
After a lengthy, lengthy development process, the No Way In Hell shuttle has been completed, and re-christened! For your viewing pleasure, the Lepton!

First off, yes, this thing looks absolutely ridiculous. It's funky features are part of it's charm. The inspiration for the Lepton comes from the fact that your standard, side-mounted shuttle clones are a pain in the butt to build, and are fiddly to fly into orbit. You need to very precisely offset your engines, and you have to worry about shifting center of mass, as well as payload weight, blablabla. To that end, the Lepton mounts it's external fueltank on the nose, meaning that the center of mass is in line with the center of thrust. Problem solved!
